Class SmartFrogTestBase

java.lang.Object
  junit.framework.Assert
      junit.framework.TestCase
          org.smartfrog.test.SmartFrogTestBase
All Implemented Interfaces:
junit.framework.Test
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeployingTestBase, LocalJVMTestBase
public abstract class SmartFrogTestBase
extends junit.framework.TestCase

A base class for smartfrog tests

deployExpectingException

protected java.lang.Throwable deployExpectingException(java.lang.String testURL,
                                                       java.lang.String appName,
                                                       java.lang.String exceptionName,
                                                       java.lang.String searchString)
                                                throws java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                       org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                                                       org.smartfrog.sfcore.security.SFGeneralSecurityException,
                                                       java.net.UnknownHostException
Deploy a component, expecting a smartfrog exception.

Parameters:
testURL - URL to test
appName - name of test app
exceptionName - name of the exception thrown
searchString - string which must be found in the exception message
Returns:
the exception that was raised
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - in the event of remote trouble.
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - The component did not deploy with some other exception
org.smartfrog.sfcore.security.SFGeneralSecurityException - security trouble
java.net.UnknownHostException - hostname is wrong

deployExpectingException

protected java.lang.Throwable deployExpectingException(java.lang.String testURL,
                                                       java.lang.String appName,
                                                       java.lang.String exceptionName,
                                                       java.lang.String searchString,
                                                       java.lang.String containedExceptionName,
                                                       java.lang.String containedExceptionText)
                                                throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException,
                                                       java.rmi.RemoteException,
                                                       java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                                       org.smartfrog.sfcore.security.SFGeneralSecurityException
Deploy a component, expecting a smartfrog exception. You can also specify the classname of a contained fault -which, if specified, must be contained, and some text to be searched for in this exception.

Parameters:
testURL - URL to test
appName - name of test app
exceptionName - name of the exception thrown (can be null)
searchString - string which must be found in the exception message (can be null)
containedExceptionName - optional classname of a contained exception; does not have to be the full name; a fraction will suffice.
containedExceptionText - optional text in the contained fault.
Returns:
the exception that was returned
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException - in the event of remote trouble.
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException - The component did not deploy with some other exception
org.smartfrog.sfcore.security.SFGeneralSecurityException - security trouble
java.net.UnknownHostException - hostname is wrong

assertFaultCauseAndTextContains

protected static void assertFaultCauseAndTextContains(java.lang.Throwable cause,
                                                      java.lang.String faultName,
                                                      java.lang.String faultText,
                                                      java.lang.String details)
/** assert that something we deployed contained the name and text we wanted.

Parameters:
cause - root cause. Can be null, if faultName and faultText are also null. It is an error if they are defined and the cause is null
faultName - substring that must be in the classname of the fault (can be null)
faultText - substring that must be in the text of the fault (can be null)
details - status string for reporting purposes

                                            throws org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogException

Returns:

mustEqual - object which must equal
prim - app to resolve against
attribute - attribute to resolve
Throws:
org.smartfrog.sfcore.common.SmartFrogResolutionException - resolution problems
java.rmi.RemoteException - network problems
java.lang.AssertionError - if a condition is not met

assertTerminationRecordContains

public static void assertTerminationRecordContains(org.smartfrog.sfcore.prim.TerminationRecord record,
                                                   java.lang.String descriptionText,
                                                   java.lang.String throwableClass,
                                                   java.lang.String throwableText)
Assert that a termination record contains the expected values. If either the throwableClass or throwableText attributes are non-null, then the record must contain a fault

Parameters:
record - termination record
descriptionText - text to look for in the description (optional; can be null)
throwableClass - fragment of the class name/package of the exception. (optional; can be null)
throwableText - text to look for in the fault text. (optional; can be null)
